solution:
First, we note that $x$ must be nonnegative, since $\sqrt{12x}$ is undefined if $x<0$.  Then, we simplify both sides of the equation.  Expanding the product on the left gives \begin{align*}
(\sqrt{12x} + 12)(\sqrt{3x} - 6) &= \sqrt{12x}(\sqrt{3x} - 6) + 12(\sqrt{3x} - 6)\\
&= \sqrt{36x^2} - 6\sqrt{12x} + 12\sqrt{3x} - 72.
\end{align*}Next, we notice that since $x>0$, we have $\sqrt{36x^2} = 6x$.  Also, we have $\sqrt{12x} = \sqrt{4\cdot 3 x} = 2\sqrt{3x}$, so  \[\sqrt{36x^2} - 6\sqrt{12x} + 12\sqrt{3x} - 72 = 6x -6(2\sqrt{3x}) + 12\sqrt{3x} - 72 = 6x- 72.\]Therefore, the left side of the original equation is equivalent to $6x-72$.  Simplifying the right side then gives $$6x-72=5x-22.$$Then we collect like terms, to get: $$x=\boxed{50}.$$
model_solution:
Step 1: Expand the equation on the left-hand side by multiplying each term in the first parentheses by each term in the second parentheses: $(\sqrt{12x}+12)(\sqrt{3x}-6)=\sqrt{36x^2}-36\sqrt{x}+12\sqrt{3x}-72.$
Step 2: Distribute the terms on the right-hand side and simplify: $4(x+3)+x-34=4x+12+x-34=5x-22.$
Step 3: Rewrite the equation by combining like terms on each side of the equation: $\sqrt{36x^2}-36\sqrt{x}+12\sqrt{3x}-72=5x-22.$
Move all terms to the left-hand side of the equation by subtracting $5x-22$ from both sides: $\sqrt{36x^2}-36\sqrt{x}+12\sqrt{3x}-72-5x+22=0$
Step 4: Move all terms with radicals to the left-hand side and all terms without radicals to the right-hand side of the equation: $\sqrt{36x^2}-36\sqrt{x}+12\sqrt{3x}-72-5x+22=0 \Longrightarrow \sqrt{36x^2}+12\sqrt{3x}-36\sqrt{x}=5x-50$
Step 5: Square both sides of the equation to eliminate the radical: $\left(\sqrt{36x^2}+12\sqrt{3x}-36\sqrt{x}\right)^2=\left(5x-50\right)^2.$
Step 6: Expand both sides of the equation: $\left(36x^2+432x\sqrt{3x}-1296x\right)=\left(25x^2-500x+2500\right)$
Expand the left-hand side of the equation by squaring the binomial: $\left(36x^2+432x\sqrt{3x}-1296x\right)^2 = 36x^4 + 46656x^3\sqrt{3} - 233472x^3 - 550368x^2\sqrt{3} + 1679616x^2$
Expand the right-hand side of the equation: $\left(25x^2-500x+2500\right) = 25x^4-500x^3+2500x^2$
Step 7: Subtract $25x^4 - 500x^3 + 2500x^2$ from both sides of the equation.
steps: Step 1: Expand the equation on the left-hand side by multiplying each term in the first parentheses by each term in the second parentheses: $(\sqrt{12x}+12)(\sqrt{3x}-6)=\sqrt{36x^2}-36\sqrt{x}+12\sqrt{3x}-72.$
Step 2: Distribute the terms on the right-hand side and simplify: $4(x+3)+x-34=4x+12+x-34=5x-22.$
Step 3: Rewrite the equation by combining like terms on each side of the equation: $\sqrt{36x^2}-36\sqrt{x}+12\sqrt{3x}-72=5x-22.$
Move all terms to the left-hand side of the equation by subtracting $5x-22$ from both sides: $\sqrt{36x^2}-36\sqrt{x}+12\sqrt{3x}-72-5x+22=0$

Step 4: Move all terms with radicals to the left-hand side and all terms without radicals to the right-hand side of the equation: $\sqrt{36x^2}-36\sqrt{x}+12\sqrt{3x}-72-5x+22=0 \Longrightarrow \sqrt{36x^2}+12\sqrt{3x}-36\sqrt{x}=5x-50$
Step 5: Square both sides of the equation to eliminate the radical: $\left(\sqrt{36x^2}+12\sqrt{3x}-36\sqrt{x}\right)^2=\left(5x-50\right)^2.$
Step 6: Expand both sides of the equation: $\left(36x^2+432x\sqrt{3x}-1296x\right)=\left(25x^2-500x+2500\right)$
Expand the left-hand side of the equation by squaring the binomial: $\left(36x^2+432x\sqrt{3x}-1296x\right)^2 = 36x^4 + 46656x^3\sqrt{3} - 233472x^3 - 550368x^2\sqrt{3} + 1679616x^2$
Expand the right-hand side of the equation: $\left(25x^2-500x+2500\right) = 25x^4-500x^3+2500x^2$
Step 7: Subtract $25x^4 - 500x^3 + 2500x^2$ from both sides of the equation.
full_steps: Step 1: Expand the equation on the left-hand side by multiplying each term in the first parentheses by each term in the second parentheses: $(\sqrt{12x}+12)(\sqrt{3x}-6)=\sqrt{36x^2}-36\sqrt{x}+12\sqrt{3x}-72.$
Step 2: Distribute the terms on the right-hand side and simplify: $4(x+3)+x-34=4x+12+x-34=5x-22.$
Step 3: Rewrite the equation by combining like terms on each side of the equation: $\sqrt{36x^2}-36\sqrt{x}+12\sqrt{3x}-72=5x-22.$
Move all terms to the left-hand side of the equation by subtracting $5x-22$ from both sides: $\sqrt{36x^2}-36\sqrt{x}+12\sqrt{3x}-72-5x+22=0$

Step 4: Move all terms with radicals to the left-hand side and all terms without radicals to the right-hand side of the equation: $\sqrt{36x^2}-36\sqrt{x}+12\sqrt{3x}-72-5x+22=0 \Longrightarrow \sqrt{36x^2}+12\sqrt{3x}-36\sqrt{x}=5x-50$
Step 5: Square both sides of the equation to eliminate the radical: $\left(\sqrt{36x^2}+12\sqrt{3x}-36\sqrt{x}\right)^2=\left(5x-50\right)^2.$
Step 6: Expand both sides of the equation: $\left(36x^2+432x\sqrt{3x}-1296x\right)=\left(25x^2-500x+2500\right)$
Expand the left-hand side of the equation by squaring the binomial: $\left(36x^2+432x\sqrt{3x}-1296x\right)^2 = 36x^4 + 46656x^3\sqrt{3} - 233472x^3 - 550368x^2\sqrt{3} + 1679616x^2$
Expand the right-hand side of the equation: $\left(25x^2-500x+2500\right) = 25x^4-500x^3+2500x^2$
Step 7: Subtract $25x^4 - 500x^3 + 2500x^2$ from both sides of the equation.
